External_Reference.reference_text: Belskaya, I.N., A.-C. Levasseur-Regourd, A. Cellino, Y.S. Efimov, N.M. Shakhovskoy, E. Hadamcik, and P. Bendjoya, Polarimetry of main belt asteroids: Wavelength dependence, Icarus 199, 97-105, 2009.
Belskaya, I.N., S. Fornasier, and Y.N. Krugly, Polarimetry and BVRI photometry of the potentially hazardous near-Earth asteroid (23187) 2000 PN9, Icarus 201, 167-171, 2009.

Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Belskaya, I.N., Levasseur-Regourd, A.-C., Cellino, A., Fornasier, S., Efimov, Y.S., Krugly, Y.N., Shakhovskoy, N.M., Hadamcik, E., and Bendjoya, P., Belskaya Asteroid Polarimetry V1.0. EAR-A-I0942/I0943-3-BELSKAYAPOL-V1.0. NASA Planetary Data System, 2010.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: UBVRI Polarimetric measurements of asteroids from Belskaya (2009)
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set contains UBVRI polarimetric measurements of ten main belt asteroids and one potentially hazardous near-Earth asteroid (NEA), from Belskaya et al. (2009) and Belskaya et al. (2009b).
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This data set includes UBVRI polarimetric measurements of ten main-belt asteroids including space mission targets 1 Ceres and 21 Lutetia, in addition to the potentially hazardous near-Earth asteroid (NEA) 23187 2000 PN9.
The main belt asteroid observations were made during 1996-2004 at the Crimean Astrophysical Observatory (CrAO) 1.25m telescope, with a five-channel UBVRI photopolarimeter, and have been reported in Belskaya et al. (2009). NEA 23187 2000 PN9 was observed in March 2006 at the Asiago Astrophysical Observatory 1.82m telescope using the Asiago Faint Object Spectrographic Camera (AFOSC) polarimeter, and have been reported in Belskaya et al. 2009b.
References ==========
Belskaya, I.N., A.-C. Levasseur-Regourd, A. Cellino, Y.S. Efimov, N.M. Shakhovskoy, E. Hadamcik, and P. Bendjoya, Polarimetry of main belt asteroids: Wavelength dependence, Icarus 199, 97-105, 2009. [BELSKAYAETAL2009]
Belskaya, I.N., S. Fornasier, and Y.N. Krugly, Polarimetry and BVRI photometry of the potentially hazardous near-Earth asteroid (23187) 2000 PN9, Icarus 201, 167-171, 2009. [BELSKAYAETAL2009B]
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Confidence Level Overview ========================= See the published papers, Belskaya et al. (2009) and Belskaya et al. (2009b) for detailed information about the reliability of the measurements.
